systemPipeShiny 0.99.0
  • Get started
  • Reference

SPS plugin operations

Source: R/spsPlugin.R
spsAddPlugin.Rd

spsAddPlugin() is used to load an existing SPS plugin, spsRemovePlugin() is to remove a loaded plugin, and spsNewPlugin() is for developers to create a minimum plugin structure and required files.

spsAddPlugin(
  plugin = "",
  app_path = getwd(),
  verbose = FALSE,
  third_party = FALSE,
  overwrite = 0,
  colorful = TRUE
)

spsRemovePlugin(
  plugin = "",
  app_path = getwd(),
  force = FALSE,
  verbose = FALSE,
  colorful = TRUE
)

spsNewPlugin(path, readme = TRUE, verbose = FALSE, colorful = TRUE)

Arguments

plugin

character, a plugin name. It can also be a path in spsAddPlugin function when if third_party = TRUE.
app_path

the SPS project you want to load plugin to
verbose

bool, show more information?
third_party

bool, is this an official plugin?
overwrite

one of 0, 1 or 2, if there are file conflicts, how to handle conflict files, see details.
colorful

bool, colorful message?
force

bool, if plugin files found, confirm before remove?
path

character string, path of where you want to create the plugin directory, can be a non-existing location but make sure you have write permission.
readme

bool, created README.md file?

Value

No return

Details

General

  • Make sure there is a 'config/tabs.csv' file in your SPS project when you load the plugin.

  • You can just use spsAddPlugin() without any argument to see what are the plugin options.

  • If there is any file conflicts when loading plugins, please see the app structure tree and refer to the legend below the tree to help you resolve conflicts. Overwriting current files is not recommended. Rename conflict files and compare them after loading the plugin will be better.

  • When a plugin is removed, only tab files from that plugin are removed and entries on config/tabs.csv are removed. Other files come from the plugin will not be removed.

overwrite mode

  • 0, if there is any conflict, abort

  • 1, overwrite all overlapping files

  • 2, ignore conflict files, only copy new files

Building a plugin

  • When adding new tabs to a plugin, it will be better to set working directory to PLUGIN_ROOT/inst/app. Tab files should go into PLUGIN_ROOT/inst/app/R.

  • Any additional files in PLUGIN_ROOT/inst/app except the config/tabs.csv will also be copied to users' project.

  • Tab files will be checked and two functions in the tab file are expected: tabIDUI and tabIDServer. Other files will not be checked for content.

  • For a plugin to work, PLUGIN_ROOT/inst/app/config/tabs.csv is required, and tab files listed in this tabs.csv are also required to be put inside PLUGIN_ROOT/inst/app/R. PLUGIN_ROOT/inst/app/welcome.txt is optional. If this file exists, content will be cat to console when plugin is loaded.

Examples

# see what official plugins you can install:
spsAddPlugin()
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-15 15:12:40 Current SPS has following plugins
#> spsBio               Biological plots
#> BiocManager::install("systemPipeR/spsBio")
# create a project
spsInit(project_name = "testProject",
        change_wd = FALSE,
        open_files = TRUE,
        overwrite = TRUE)
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-15 15:12:40 Start to create a new SPS project
#> Warning: 
[SPS-WARNING] 2020-09-15 15:12:40 Overwrite things in /home/lz/Desktop/systemPipeShiny/docs/reference/testProject
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-15 15:12:40 Now copy files
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-15 15:12:40 Create SPS database
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-15 15:12:40 Created SPS database method container
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-15 15:12:40 Creating SPS db...
#> [SPS-DANGER] 2020-09-15 15:12:40 Db created at '/home/lz/Desktop/systemPipeShiny/docs/reference/testProject/config/sps.db'. DO NOT share this file with others
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-15 15:12:40 Key md5 07894d220f9aeea754b5366a95cda11f
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-15 15:12:40 SPS project setup done!
# create a new plugin
spsNewPlugin(path = "testPlugin")
#> [SPS-SUCCESS] 2020-09-15 15:12:40 Plugin testPlugin created
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-15 15:12:40 Optional: To format the plugin folder to a more publishable structure, run following
#> usethis::create_package("testPlugin")
# add some tabs to the plugin
# tabs
plugin_path <- file.path("testPlugin", "inst", "app")
newTabData("data_a",
           app_path = plugin_path,
           plugin = "testPlugin",
           reformat = FALSE,
           open_file = FALSE)
#> Error: 
[SPS-ERROR] 2020-09-15 15:12:40 File testPlugin/inst/app/R/tab_vs_data_a.R exists.
newTabPlot("plot_a",
           app_path = plugin_path,
           plot_data = list(makePlotData(receive_datatab_ids = 'data_a',
                                    app_path = plugin_path)),
           plugin = "testPlugin",
           reformat = FALSE,
           open_file = FALSE)
#> Error: 
[SPS-ERROR] 2020-09-15 15:12:40 File testPlugin/inst/app/R/tab_vs_plot_a.R exists.
# load the plugin, the plugin is not published, so `third_party = TRUE`
spsAddPlugin(plugin = "testPlugin",
              app_path = "testProject",
              third_party = TRUE,
              overwrite = 1)
#> New directory will be: 
#> +-- deploy.R
#> +-- global.R
#> +-- README.md
#> +-- results
#> |   L-- README.md
#> +-- server.R
#> +-- ui.R
#> +-- www
#> |   +-- about
#> |   |   +-- dcassol.md
#> |   |   +-- gmosher.md
#> |   |   +-- jzhang.md
#> |   |   +-- lzhang.md
#> |   |   +-- pramasamy.md
#> |   |   L-- tgirke.md
#> |   +-- css
#> |   |   L-- sps.css
#> |   +-- img
#> |   |   +-- noimg.png
#> |   |   +-- sps_small.png
#> |   |   +-- sps_wf.png
#> |   |   L-- sps.png
#> |   +-- js
#> |   |   +-- sps_update_pg.js
#> |   |   L-- sps.js
#> |   +-- loading_themes
#> |   |   +-- double-helix.js
#> |   |   +-- LICENSE-particlesjs.md
#> |   |   +-- micro.js1
#> |   |   +-- nyan.css
#> |   |   +-- nyan.html
#> |   |   +-- particles.min.js
#> |   |   +-- vhelix.css
#> |   |   L-- vhelix.html
#> |   L-- plot_list
#> |       +-- plot_bar.png
#> |       +-- plot_pca.png
#> |       +-- plot_point.png
#> |       L-- plot_tsne.jpg
#> +-- config
#> |   +-- README.md
#> |   +-- sps_options.yaml
#> |   +-- sps.db
#> |   L-- tabs.csv
#> +-- data
#> |   +-- config.yaml
#> |   +-- countDFeByg.xls
#> |   +-- DEGcounts.xls
#> |   +-- edgeR_DF.xls
#> |   +-- iris.csv
#> |   +-- README.md
#> |   +-- systemPipeRNAseq.md
#> |   +-- targets.txt
#> |   L-- targetsPE.txt
#> L-- R
#>     +-- README.md
#>     +-- **tab_vs_data_a.R
#>     L-- **tab_vs_plot_a.R
#> -- Old files -- *New files
#> -- **Overlapping files Directory
#> Warning: 
[SPS-WARNING] 2020-09-15 15:12:40 Overlapping files detected and will be overwritten
#> Error: Can't combine `..1$displayed` <double> and `..2$displayed` <character>.
# check if the plugin is added
# You should see `tab_vs_data_a.R` and `tab_vs_plot_a.R`
list.files(file.path("testProject", "R"))
#> [1] "README.md"       "tab_vs_data_a.R" "tab_vs_plot_a.R"
# check if tab files are registered
# You should see the two new records
vroom::vroom(file.path("testProject", "config", "tabs.csv"),
             comment = "#") %>% tail()
#> Rows: 13
#> Columns: 8
#> Delimiter: ","
#> chr [7]: tab_id, display_label, type, type_sub, image, tab_file_name, plugin
#> dbl [1]: displayed
#> 
#> Use `spec()` to retrieve the guessed column specification
#> Pass a specification to the `col_types` argument to quiet this message
#> # A tibble: 6 x 8
#>   tab_id  display_label   type  type_sub image    displayed tab_file_name plugin
#>   <chr>   <chr>           <chr> <chr>    <chr>        <dbl> <chr>         <chr> 
#> 1 wf_run  Workflow Run    wf    NA       NA               1 No file for â€¦ core  
#> 2 wf_tarâ€¦ Workflow Metadâ€¦ wf    NA       NA               1 No file for â€¦ core  
#> 3 wf_wf   Workflow Steps  wf    NA       NA               1 No file for â€¦ core  
#> 4 vs_main Visualization â€¦ vs    NA       NA               1 No file for â€¦ core  
#> 5 data_eâ€¦ Data Tab Exampâ€¦ vs    data     NA               1 No file for â€¦ core  
#> 6 plot_eâ€¦ Plot Tab Exampâ€¦ vs    plot     plot_liâ€¦         1 No file for â€¦ core  
# now remove the plugin
spsRemovePlugin(plugin = "testPlugin", app_path = "testProject", force = TRUE)
#> Warning: 
[SPS-WARNING] 2020-09-15 15:12:40 No plugin matched
# let check these files again:
list.files(file.path("testProject", "R"))
#> [1] "README.md"       "tab_vs_data_a.R" "tab_vs_plot_a.R"
vroom::vroom(file.path("testProject", "config", "tabs.csv"),
             comment = "#") %>% tail()
#> Rows: 13
#> Columns: 8
#> Delimiter: ","
#> chr [7]: tab_id, display_label, type, type_sub, image, tab_file_name, plugin
#> dbl [1]: displayed
#> 
#> Use `spec()` to retrieve the guessed column specification
#> Pass a specification to the `col_types` argument to quiet this message
#> # A tibble: 6 x 8
#>   tab_id  display_label   type  type_sub image    displayed tab_file_name plugin
#>   <chr>   <chr>           <chr> <chr>    <chr>        <dbl> <chr>         <chr> 
#> 1 wf_run  Workflow Run    wf    NA       NA               1 No file for â€¦ core
